questions.question_text:
You have an event that needs to be bound to a non-host CI.
Which attribute needs to be removed from the Transform and Compose tab?

choices.D: When the anomaly score is greater than 100
choices.A: When the statistical model threshold is breached
choices.B: When they are promoted to IT alerts
choices.C: When it is manually promoted in insights explorer

questions.question_text: When are anomaly alerts generated by Operational Intelligence displayed in alert intelligence?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. When the statistical model threshold is breached
All other options makes no sense, as you can read in the documentation:
"Data that is outside the control bounds is considered a statistical outlier. These outliers are used to compute an anomaly score, which is a value between 0–10 that indicates the degree to which the metric appears unlikely. When an anomaly score is above a threshold, an anomaly alert is generated. Anomaly alerts are reported separately from regular IT alerts."

A. When the statistical model threshold is breached
All other options makes no sense, as you can read in the documentation:
"Data that is outside the control bounds is considered a statistical outlier. These outliers are used to compute an anomaly score, which is a value between 0–10 that indicates the degree to which the metric appears unlikely. When an anomaly score is above a threshold, an anomaly alert is generated. Anomaly alerts are reported separately from regular IT alerts."
